charges.charge_disposition: Motion to reduce sentence pursuant to 2014 Drug Guidelines Amendment 782 is granted and the defendants previously imposed sentence of imprisonment of 324 months is reduced to 294 months.  ORIGINAL SENTENCE: Defendant is sentenced to 324 months on Count 1 and 240 months on Count 6. Count 6 to run concurrent to Count 1. Defendant remanded to custody and advised of his right to appeal.

charges.charge_disposition: The defendant pleaded guilty to Counts 1 and 6 of the Superseding Indictment on January 20, 2005. IMPRISONMENT - The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 84 months on Count 1s and 84 months on Count 6s to run concurrently. The Court recommends to the Bureau of Prisons that the defendant be allowed to participate in the 500-Hour Drug Treatment Program. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by the Bureau of Prisons before 12:00 P.M. on October 10, 2006. SUPERVISED RELEASE - Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 4 years on Count 1s and 3 years on Count 6s to run concurrently. Standard and special conditions of supervision are requested. CRIMINAL MONETARY PENALTIES - MSA $200. No fine. No restitution.

The defendant pleaded guilty to Count 1 of the superseding indictment on 1/19/05. Count(s) 6, 11, and 34 are dismissed on the motion of the United States. IMPRISONMENT: the defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 48 months. Defendant has served 4 months on a State charge which is part of this conduct and that time will be deducted from this sentence for a total term of 44 months. The State case # is 04-04750. The Court recommends that defendant be allowed to partipate in the 500 Hour Intensive Drug Treatment Program and that he be placed in the facility in Yankton, South Dakota. The defendant is allowed to surrender to the institution selected by the Bureau of Prisons on 10/3/2005 at 12:00 p.m. SUPERVISED RELEASE: upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 4 years, with Standard and Special Conditions. $100 MSA. No Fine. No Restitution.

The defendant pleaded guilty to Counts 1 &; 6 on 1/21/05. IMPRISONMENT: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 72 months on Counts 1 and 6 to run concurrently. The court recommends to the Bureau of Prisons: That defendant be placed in the Medical Center for Federal Prisoners (MCFP) located in Springfield, Missouri, so he may be near family. The Court also recommends the defendant participate in the 500 Hour Intensive Drug Treatment Program. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 5 years. Count 1 a term of 5 years and Count 6 for a term of 3 years to run concurrent for a term of 5 years; With Standard and Special Conditions. No Fine. No Restitution. $200 MSA.

SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 5 years. Count 1 a term of 5 years and Count 6 for a term of 3 years to run concurrent for a term of 5 years; With Standard and Special Conditions. No Fine. No Restitution. $200 MSA.

Defendant is sentenced to the BOP for a term of 121 months on Count 1 of the superseding indictment; Defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 5 years; See J&;C for Special Conditions of Supervised Release; fine is waived, costs of incarceration and supervision are waived; Defendant shall pay a special assessment fee in the amount of $100.00 which is due immediately; The Court recommends the BOP allow defendant to parcitipate in the 500-Hour Intensive Drug Treatment Program and place him in a facility located as close to the Kansas City area as possible. Defendant in custody and advised of his right to appeal.

Defendant is sentenced to the BOP for a term of 96 months on Count 1 of the superseding indictment. Defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 5 years; Please see J&;C for Special Conditions of Supervised Release; Defendant shall pay a Special Assessment fee in the amount of $100.00 which is due immediately; fine and costs are wavied; The Court recommends defendant be allowed to participate in the 500-Hour Intensive Drug Treatment Program and that he be placed in a facility located as close to the Kansas City area as possible so he may be near his family; Defendant remanded to custody and advised of his right to appeal.

THE DEFENDANT: admitted guilt to violation of condition(s) of the term of supervision. IMPRISONMENT: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 24 Months. No Term of Supervised Release to Follow. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. * Amended to correct sentence time from 121 months to 120 months on Count 1s.
* Amended to correct sentence time from 121 months to 120 months on Count 1s.

Defendant is sentenced to 37 months on Count 1 of the superseding indictment; Defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 5 years; See J&;C for Special Conditions of Supervised Release; the fine and costs are waived; Defendant shall pay a Special Assessment fee in the amount of $100.00; The Court recommends that defendant be allowed to participate in the 500-Hour Intensive Drug Treatment Program and that he be placed in the Leavenworth Camp or as close to the Kansas City area as possible. Defendant advised of his right to appeal and allowed to surrender on 10/24/2005 at 12:00 p.m.

The defendant pleaded guilty to Count 1 on 2/1/2005 of the Superseding Indictment. IMPRISONMENT: the defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of 120 months. The Court recommends to the Bureau of Prisons: The defendant be placed in the Medical Facility located in Springfield, Missouri due to his medical conditions and that he may be allowed to participate in the 500-Hour Drug Treatment Program. The defendant shall surrender for service of sentence at the institution designated by Bureau of Prisons before 12:00 P.M. on October 17, 2005. SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term 5 years; With Standard and Special Conditions. $100 MSA. No Fine. No Restitution.

The defendant admitted guilt to violation of condition(s) Mandatory Condition of the term of supervision. IMPRISONMENT: The defendant is hereby committed to the custody of the United States Bureau of Prisons to be imprisoned for a total term of Time Served. The defendant is remanded to the custody of the United States Marshal. SUPERVISED RELEASE: Upon release from imprisonment, the defendant shall be on supervised release for a term of 1 year. Standard and additional conditions of release imposed. ORIGINAL SENTENCE: Defendant is sentenced to 57 months on Count 1 of the superseding indictment; Defendant shall be placed on Supervised Release for a term of 3 years. See J&;C for Special Conditions of Supervised Release; Defendant shall pay a Special Assessment Fee in the amount of $100.00 which is due immediately; fine and costs are waived; The Court recommends defendant be allowed to participate in the 500-Hour Drug Treatment Program and that he be placed in facility located as close to the Kansas City area as possible so he may be near his son. Counts 33s and 34s are dismissed; Defendant advised of his right to appeal and remanded to custody.
Dismissed on the motion of the United States.

Defendant is placed on Probation for a term of 4 years on Count 6s of the Superseding Indictment; No fine or costs of supervision are assessed. See J&;C for Special Conditions of Probation; Defendant shall pay a Special Assessment fee in the amount of $100.00 which is due immediately; Counts 1s,13s,14s, 17s,19s, 20s and 24s are dismissed by the Court upon oral motion of the government. Defendant advised of her right to appeal.
